## Biography

I will be a **tenure-track assistant professor** at the Data Management Innovation Research Center, **Nanjing University, Suzhou Campus**. Previously, I was a postdoctoral researcher in the Department of Statistics and Data Science, Southern University of Science and Technology (July 2023–December 2025). My research expertise lies in **Science of Science**, **Complex Networks**, and **Scientometrics**. I am particularly interested in the career development paths of young scholars and the mechanisms of academic mentorship.

My recent research, published in [***Nature Human Behaviour***](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41562-025-02114-8), explores how academic group size influences mentee's scientific career. This work has been highlighted by [***Nature News***: "How a PhD student’s lab size affects their chance of future academic success"](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-025-00644-9).

## News

* **[01.2026]** Since **01.2026**, I have been serving as an independent **Principal Investigator (PI)** at Nanjing University.
* **[03.2025]** Our work on mentorship published in ***Nature Human Behaviour*** is featured by [**Nature News**](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-025-00644-9)!
* **[08.2024]** New preprint available: "Exaptation: Academic mentees' career pathway to be independent and impactful."

## Research Interests

* **Science of Science**: Mentorship dynamics, career trajectories, and academic independence.
* **Complex Systems**: Network resilience, cascading failures, and structural analysis.
* **Data Science**: Processing large-scale scholarly datasets (OpenAlex, MAG, APS) using Python and SQL.
